main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified flying objects (UFOs) in various locations, including Kirtland AFB in New Mexico and Brookley AFB in Alabama, reported in September 1952.
interesting points: The objects were described as having speeds exceeding 3,000 mph., Separate witness accounts include observations of bluish-gray lights moving silently and swiftly in formations., Mrs. Frank Goody reported seeing six to eight objects with bright lights, which she initially mistook for a helicopter., Investigations revealed no known aircraft accounted for during the reported sightings., Witness reliability was deemed excellent based on corroborated observations from various individuals.
sighted object: oval-shaped objects and bluish-gray lights in the sky
witness description: Mrs. Frank Goody (housewife) and her husband observed the lights together.
